title: Jen: How To Fix Your Air
description: Jen, we saw your review. It sounded like you may have a dirty filter or a clog. Here's how to fix it. Thanks! Sharon.

asset.title: Jen: How To Fix Your Air
asset.description: Jen, we saw your review. It sounded like you may have a dirty filter or a clog. Here's how to fix it. Thanks! Sharon.
asset.author: HooverVideoGuides
asset.hookText: Jen, we saw your review. It sounded like you may have a dirty filter or a clog. Here's how to fix it. Thanks! Sharon.

transcripts: Hi Jen, it's Sharron from Hoover customer care. I read your review of the Air not picking up like it used to. It sounds like it could be one of two problems. A dirty filter or a clog. Let's first check the filter. Remove your dirt cup, twist off the top, and remove the filter like this. If you haven't cleaned it recently, you should rinse t under the sink for about two minutes. Let it stand and dry fro 24 hours. Now let's check fora clog. I have a neat trick. Remove the hose here, take a coin and drop it through. If it doesn't come out the other end easily, there may be a clog. Work it out of the hose, but do not use any sharp items to do so. I hope that helps.
